creator: peter_finch@mentor.com
text:
The load-dtd-grammer feature does not seem to work with schema grammers.  
Validation against schema is a time consuming process and not always necessary.  
But the ability to resolve ID attributes and default attribute values from the 
schema is necessary for data integrety.

I've attached sample schema, xml and java files to demonstrate the different 
results obtained when validating and not validating.

creator: pavani.mukthipudi@sun.com
text:
The load-dtd-grammar feature has no effect when a schema grammar 
is provided. It's only meant for DTDs. However, the bug here is 
that the schema file is not being parsed when validation is off. 
The grammar should be built irrespective of the validation 
feature which is not being done in the case of schema grammar.

We had some discussions about it before and decided that for performance reasons 
in Xerces1 when validation is off, we won't process any schemas, nor instantiate 
schema datatype registry. We did not have any requirements to change this 
behavior, however, we did have a requirement not to sacrifice the performance 
for non-validating parsing for DTDs. So this behavior will not be changed in 
Xerces1.
In Xerces2 however, if validator is in the pipeline XML Schemas will be 
processed.
